snippet: Those who worry more about the Islamic State emphasize its recruiting power on social media; those more concerned with Qaeda affiliates warn of “mass casualty” attacks.
abstract: Top federal officials are split over whether Islamic State or Al Qaeda poses gravest risk to United States homeland; Obama administration appears to be most concerned with Islamic State; debate will affect how government spends billions of dollars against terrorism, and how it assigns thousands of agents, analysts and troops to combat threat.
lead_paragraph: Those who worry more about the Islamic State emphasize its recruiting power on social media; those more concerned with Qaeda affiliates warn of “mass casualty” attacks.

headline.main: ISIS or Al Qaeda? American Officials Split Over Top Terror Threat
headline.print_headline: Officials Split on Chief Risk:Qaeda or ISIS

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
